(Weak) The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Whoever gives a fatwa without verification, the sin is only upon the one who gave the fatwa.

(Weak) Whoever gives a fatwa without knowledge, the sin of that is upon the one who gave the fatwa.

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Weak) Whoever gives a fatwa to the people without knowledge, the angels of the heaven and the angels of the earth curse him. [6]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Authentic) Indeed, Allah does not take away knowledge by snatching it from the chests of men, but He takes away knowledge by the death of scholars, until when no scholar remains, people take ignorant leaders who are asked and give fatwas without knowledge, so they go astray and lead others astray. [7]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Hasan/Good) The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked: Which lands are the worst? He said: I do not know. So he asked Gabriel, who said: I do not know. So he asked his Lord, the Mighty and Majestic, who said: (Their markets). [9]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text:
(Authentic according to the condition of Muslim) Islam will wear out as the embroidery on a garment wears out, until it is not known what fasting, prayer, rites, or charity are. And the Book of Allah will be taken away in a night, so not a verse of it will remain on earth. And groups of people will remain: the old man and the old woman, saying: We found our fathers upon this word: 'La ilaha illa Allah' (There is no god but Allah), so we say it. Silah bin Zufar said to Hudhayfah: What will 'La ilaha illa Allah' avail them when they do not know what fasting, prayer, rites, or charity are? Hudhayfah turned away from him. He repeated it three times, each time Hudhayfah turned away from him. Then he turned to him on the third time and said: O Silah, it will save them from the Fire, it will save them from the Fire, it will save them from the Fire. [28]

(Weak) Cursed is he who harms a Muslim or plots against him.

(Authentic) Plotting and deception are in the Fire.

(Hasan/Good) Do not commit what the Jews committed, making lawful the prohibitions of Allah Almighty by the slightest tricks.

(Hasan/Good) What is the matter with people playing with the limits of Allah Almighty and mocking His verses: I divorced you (Khul'), I took you back; I divorced you, I took you back.

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Authentic) May Allah curse the Jews; fats were forbidden to them, so they melted them, sold them, and consumed their price. [33]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Authentic) The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: It is sufficient lying - or sin - for a man to speak of everything he hears. [49]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text:
(Hasan/Good) His saying, peace and blessings be upon him: There should be neither harming nor reciprocating harm in Islam. [54]

(Authentic) Follow the example of those after me: Abu Bakr and Umar.

(Authentic) Adhere to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs after me; bite onto it with your molar teeth.

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text:
(Weak/Baseless) My Companions are like the stars; whichever of them you follow, you will be guided. [55]

(Authentic) Consult your heart (seek fatwa from yourself), even if they give you fatwas, and give you fatwas, and give you fatwas.

(Authentic) Leave that which makes you doubt for that which does not make you doubt.

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Authentic) Sin is what wavers in the soul. [56]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Not authentic as raised to the Prophet - Marfu') Indeed, this knowledge is religion, so look to whom you take it from. [70]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Weak/Baseless) My Companions are like the stars; whichever of them you follow, you will be guided. [71]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Its chain is Authentic) And he also said: Indeed, Allah loves that His concessions be taken, just as He loves that His strict commandments be performed. [80]

book_title: Characteristics of the Fatwa, the Mufti, and the Mustafti (Questioner)
text: (Authentic) These two are forbidden for the males of my nation, lawful for its females. [90]

text: (Weak) There is no harm in the skin of a dead animal if it is tanned, nor in its wool and hair if washed. [91]

text: (Authentic) Indeed, Allah loves lofty matters and dislikes trivial ones. [93]
